content.text: Technology DNA analysis identifies the technology stack used by your website, including web frameworks, CMS platforms, server technologies, libraries, and their specific versions. This information is crucial for security assessment and vulnerability detection.

Knowing your technology stack allows us to cross-reference with CVE databases to find known vulnerabilities in specific versions. Different versions of the same technology can have vastly different security postures. For example, WordPress 4.0 has different vulnerabilities than WordPress 6.0.

items: Web frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Next.js, etc.)
CMS platforms (WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, etc.)
Server technologies (PHP, Node.js, Python, ASP.NET, etc.)
JavaScript libraries and their versions
CSS frameworks (Bootstrap, Tailwind, etc.)
Database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.)
Web servers (Apache, Nginx, IIS, etc.)
CDN providers and services

content.text: VaultGuard Pro analyzes multiple sources to identify technologies:

items: HTTP Headers: Server, X-Powered-By, X-AspNet-Version headers reveal server technologies
HTML Meta Tags: Generator tags, framework identifiers in HTML
JavaScript Files: Library names, version numbers in JavaScript code
DOM Structure: Framework-specific patterns and class names
File Paths: URLs and file structures that indicate frameworks
Cookie Names: Framework-specific cookie naming patterns
CVE Cross-Reference: Finding known vulnerabilities for specific versions
Version-Specific Attacks: Identifying exploits that target specific versions
Update Prioritization: Knowing which components need urgent updates
Security Posture Assessment: Understanding overall security maturity
Compliance Checking: Verifying if technologies meet security standards
Keep all components and dependencies up to date
Remove or hide version information from headers when possible
Regularly audit your technology stack
Monitor security advisories for technologies you use
Use automated tools to detect outdated components
Maintain a software inventory with versions

content.title: Header Analysis
content.text: Server headers like 'X-Powered-By: PHP/7.4.3' or 'Server: nginx/1.18.0' directly reveal technologies and versions.

content.title: JavaScript Fingerprinting
content.text: JavaScript libraries often include version information in their code or expose it through global variables (e.g., jQuery exposes $.fn.jquery with the version).

content.title: HTML Patterns
content.text: Frameworks leave distinctive patterns in HTML, such as React's data-reactroot attributes or Angular's ng-* attributes.
